revised_title: Studies in the Morphology of Spore-producing Members: Ophioglossaceae
tldr: The author examines the morphology of spore-producing members in the Ophioglossaceae family, specifically focusing on Ophioglossum and related genera. They study the development and structure of sporangia and synangia, and explore the relationship between Ophioglossaceae and Lycopods. The author concludes that both families likely share a common ancestor and that Ophioglossum may represent a series of increasing complexity in the family.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
